newsitem.title: USA: N.J. board approves $138 mln local bond proposals.
newsitem.headline: N.J. board approves $138 mln local bond proposals.

text.p: New Jersey's Local Finance Board approved $138 million of proposed bond issues from five local governments at its monthly meeting Wednesday, the board said.
The largest issue approved was a $113 million refunding bond by Essex County.
The board also approved the following proposals:
--$1 million South Hackensack Township refunding bonds.
The finance board, which must approve all local bond issues, also Wednesday approved a series of proposed project financings.
The largest was a $4.4 million plan by the Little Egg Harbor Municipal Utilities Authority.
